altTitles.ja: 江口寿史のなんとかなるでショ！

description.en:
This is the author's third collection of short stories. A masterpiece that Eguchi himself worked on from the binding to the composition and the layout of the characters. It was featured in the weekly photo magazine "Hisashi Eguchi Revival" and introduced as a friendship story between Eguchi and the owner of a coffee shop.

Various short stories from 1985 to 1988 are recorded in this work, centering on the title work "Hisashi Eguchi no NANTOKA NARUDESHO!", serialized in "Monthly ASUKA". In addition to Eguchi's work, the works of doujinka Anju & Shion are also included.

biography.en:
**Name** (in native language)
江口寿史
**Associated Names**
Egutchi Hisashi
Eguti Hisasi
えぐちひさし
江口寿監

---
He made his professional manga debut with “Osorubeki Kodomo-tachi” in Weekly Shonen Jump in 1977. Later in the same year he started serializing Susume!! Pirates.

In 1995, he founded the "alternative" yearly comic magazine Comic Cue.
Once crowned as the most late mangaka to meet the deadline, the 2nd best was KOBAYASHI Makoto.

Was once under Horie Nobuhiko’s editorial team.
A fan of Yamagai Tatsuhiko and was his assistant.

Ichijo Yuko, Nishiaki Grin & Kono Tetsuro were his assistants.

Friends with Inoue Masaharu, Tamura Shin, Otomo Katsuhiro and Kamijo Atsushi.
